decks.notes: The deck revolves around assembling a winning combination of cards, typically utilizing Doomsday to set up a powerful sequence of plays that lead to victory. It includes a range of powerful spells like Demonic Tutor, Force of Will, and Black Lotus to enable the combo and protect it from disruption. The deck also includes cards like Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation to provide alternative win conditions. By carefully planning and executing the Doomsday combo, the deck aims to quickly outmaneuver and overwhelm its opponent in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on assembling and executing the Doomsday combo, using key cards like Thassa's Oracle and Street Wraith to win the game. It includes various tutors and card draw spells to help find and set up the combo efficiently. The deck also runs a number of permission spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It has a solid mana base with powerful mana rocks like Black Lotus and Mox Jet to accelerate its game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements like counter spells, card draw, and disruptive creatures to maintain board dominance and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful win conditions like Blightsteel Colossus and Managorger Hydra to quickly close out games. The deck's mana base is streamlined with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands, along with powerful mana rocks like the Moxen and Sol Ring. The inclusion of key Vintage restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk further enhances the deck's ability to control the game and overpower opponents.

The deck focuses on aggressively deploying artifact creatures and using mana acceleration to quickly build a board presence. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Walking Ballista, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Tangle Wire. With the support of cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Chief of the Foundry, the deck can control the opponent's resources while pushing for a fast victory. The inclusion of powerful artifact/land mana sources like Mishra's Workshop and Tolarian Academy allows for explosive starts and efficient plays.

The deck focuses on using powerful mana acceleration cards like Sol Ring and the Moxen to quickly cast spells and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Hullbreacher to control card advantage and prevent the opponent from drawing cards. The deck includes a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and proactive in its plays, aiming to quickly close out the game while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on using a combination of disruptive spells and powerful card advantage engines to control the game while also applying pressure with efficient threats. By utilizing cheap spells like Preordain, Pyroblast, and Swords to Plowshares alongside cards like Dack Fayden and Dreadhorde Arcanist, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantages. With access to powerful cards like Time Walk, Ancestral Recall, and Force of Will, the deck can quickly turn the tide of the game in its favor while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to control the game and slow down the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Null Rod, Chalice of the Void, and Thorn of Amethyst, the deck can disrupt the opponent's plays while locking them out of key resources with cards like Trinisphere and God-Pharaoh's Statue. Additionally, the deck includes powerful utility lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Tolarian Academy to further control the game. By assembling a lock with these artifacts and lands, the deck aims to take over the game and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Hollow One, and Narcomoeba to quickly fill the graveyard and trigger abilities that bring back creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam for explosive combos. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to disrupt opponents and protect key pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a continuous stream of threats from the graveyard. Additionally, the deck includes powerful utility lands like Bazaar of Baghdad and Strip Mine to further control the game and disrupt opponents' strategies.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful card "Underworld Breach" to enable a combo that allows the player to cast spells from their graveyard repeatedly. By filling the graveyard with key spells like Brain Freeze and other powerful spells, the deck aims to create a loop that can mill the opponent out or generate a large storm count for a lethal Brain Freeze. The deck is also equipped with strong interaction and card selection tools to protect the combo and ensure it goes off smoothly.

The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts to slow down the opponent while ramping up with mana acceleration. It aims to lock down the opponent with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere, while also using powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge to generate card advantage and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes land destruction cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast mana and disruptive artifacts.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo using cards like Thespian's Stage and Mirage Mirror to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token quickly. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim helps to search for key pieces, while disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void, Sorcerous Spyglass, and Sphere of Resistance slow down the opponent. The deck also includes powerful Vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus and Time Vault for additional advantage. The goal is to efficiently ramp into the combo while controlling the opponent's board state to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach in combination with various draw spells, counterspells, and tutors to quickly assemble a winning sequence. By filling the graveyard and casting spells from it using Underworld Breach, the deck aims to generate a large storm count and eventually win the game with Brain Freeze or Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's strategies and lock them out of the game using resource denial and disruption cards like Sphere of Resistance, Thorn of Amethyst, and Sorcerous Spyglass. It also utilizes powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to generate additional advantages and threats. The inclusion of Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland allows for repeated land destruction, while cards like Trinisphere and Null Rod further slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and resource denial tactics.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus, Moxen, and rituals to quickly assemble a storm count and generate a large amount of mana. Key cards like Tendrils of Agony, Yawgmoth's Will, and Bolas's Citadel are used to replicate spells, draw cards, and deal lethal damage through the storm mechanic. The deck includes a variety of tutors and card selection spells to find the key pieces needed for the win condition. It also includes disruption in the form of Duress, Defense Grid, and Chain of Vapor to protect the combo.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies while gradually building up board presence and card advantage. By combining powerful disruptive cards like Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, the deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Collector Ouphe further enhances the disruption strategy while also providing additional utility. The deck also has access to powerful draw spells and tutors to find key cards when needed.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board while maintaining card advantage. By using cards like Force of Will, Pyroblast, and Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo. Cards like Dack Fayden and Dreadhorde Arcanist provide additional card advantage and value, while efficient cantrips like Preordain and Brainstorm help dig for key cards. With a mix of control elements and aggressive threats like Monastery Mentor, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.
